description: In studying the impact of the Civil War era on American society and politics, students focus on
slavery, emancipation, and race relations.  They also address the impact of industrialization on
northern society, encompassing immigration and nativism, the westward movement, and the
dispossession of Native Americans.  The course situates the dramatic political and military
events of the era in the wider evolution of American life.  Offered most years. Counts toward
American studies and race and ethnic studies majors and race and ethnic studies and
fullname: America in the Civil War and Reconstruction Era
